title: Super-Simple, Super-Spicy Mongolian Beef Recipe
description: This spicy Mongolian beef is marinated with soy, hoisin, sesame, sugar, garlic, and chili, then quickly stir-fried with green onions for a tasty dish.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Chinese Super-Simple, Super-Spicy Mongolian Beef 4.6 (465) 334 Reviews 55 Photos This spicy Mongolian beef is a great-tasting recipe that is easy to prepare and takes minutes to cook! Serve with rice and a veggie side for a nice family dinner. Submitted by Ang Updated on April 27, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 55 55 55 55 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Additional Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 25 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings ¼ cup soy sauce 1 tablespoon hoisin sauce 1 tablespoon sesame oil 2 teaspoons white sugar 1 tablespoon minced garlic 1 tablespoon red pepper flakes (Optional) 1 pound beef flank steak, thinly sliced 1 tablespoon peanut oil 2 large green onions, thinly sliced Directions Whisk together soy sauce, hoisin sauce, sesame oil, sugar, garlic, and red pepper flakes in a large bowl. Toss beef with marinade; cover the bowl and refrigerate for 1 hour to overnight. Heat peanut oil in a wok or large, nonstick skillet over high heat. Cook and stir green onions in hot oil for 5 to 10 seconds. Remove beef from marinade and add to green onions in the wok; discard marinade. Cook and stir until beef is no longer pink and begins to brown, about 5 minutes. I Made It Print 566 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 200 Calories 12g Fat 8g Carbs 15g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 200 % Daily Value * Total Fat 12g 15% Saturated Fat 3g 16% Cholesterol 25mg 8% Sodium 996mg 43% Total Carbohydrate 8g 3% Dietary Fiber 1g 4% Total Sugars 4g Protein 15g 31% Vitamin C 5mg 5% Calcium 29mg 2% Iron 2mg 9% Potassium 289mg 6% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Add Your Photo Photos of Super-Simple, Super-Spicy Mongolian Beef 01 of 55 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 55 Photo by  ProPie9713 02/08/2025 Great flavors Family favorite A keeper! This was a great recipe to make. Tastes delicious! Will definitely make again! 03 of 55 Photo by  Kashmir 01/11/2025 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow This was soooooo good! The only thing I changed was to add some gochujang (we prefer spicy) and marinate it overnight. Tossed in some mushrooms with the green onion. This is a keeper! The only thing I would adjust is maybe reduce the soy sauce just a bit as it's just a bit too salty as-is, but otherwise this is excellent! 04 of 55 Photo by  Marisa Singerman 02/26/2021 I really liked how it came out but adjusted to 1 tsp for red pepper flakes because I can handle a little bit of spiciness but not too much. My friends and family liked it too. I also marinated it overnight so the sauce could really soak in. 05 of 55 Photo by  Cheryl 06/14/2020 06 of 55 Photo by  Eric Ochieng 05/19/2020 07 of 55 Photo by  Kathie 04/30/2020 This was beyond AMAZING!! My guys loved this!! The only changes I made were: used only 1 tsp of red pepper flakes per pound of flank steak, doubled the sauce and thickened it with 2 1/2 tsp of flour per 2 lbs of flank (a must), and sprinkled sesame seeds over the beef while cooking. Also followed another persons addition of matchstick carrots and yellow onions sauté in sesame oil with garlic. I used 4 carrots, 3 onions, and 3 tsp. garlic per 2lbs of flank steak. Thank you for this DELICIOUS recipe!! 08 of 55 Photo by  s3adrag0n 03/07/2020 09 of 55 Photo by  David Cardwell 01/05/2020 10 of 55 Photo by  Captain Anegada 09/06/2019 I had no hoisin sauce, so added tbsp of mirin, 2 tsp peanut butter, additional tbsp roasted sesame oil. The heat was just right, though next time I will use low sodium soy sauce. It was a little too salty. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Orange Peel Beef 56 Ratings Bitter Melon and Black Bean Sauce Beef 7 Ratings Beef Lo Mein 175 Ratings Chap Chee Noodles 132 Ratings Japchae 25 Ratings Mongolian Beef 51 Ratings Beef with Vegetables 91 Ratings Spicy Sweet Steak Stir Fry 4 Ratings Japanese Beef Stir-Fry 274 Ratings Spicy Beef Bulgogi 23 Ratings Black Pepper Beef and Cabbage Stir Fry 780 Ratings Mild Thai Beef with a Tangerine Sauce 6 Ratings Healthy Steak Stir-Fry 12 Ratings Chinese Pepper Round Steak 59 Ratings Vietnamese Stir-Fry 17 Ratings Jamey's Restaurant Style Beef and Broccoli 48 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Ang
instructions: Whisk together soy sauce, hoisin sauce, sesame oil, sugar, garlic, and red pepper flakes in a large bowl. Toss beef with marinade; cover the bowl and refrigerate for 1 hour to overnight.;Heat peanut oil in a wok or large, nonstick skillet over high heat. Cook and stir green onions in hot oil for 5 to 10 seconds. Remove beef from marinade and add to green onions in the wok; discard marinade. Cook and stir until beef is no longer pink and begins to brown, about 5 minutes.
